items.summary: Hyderabad police have uncovered a sophisticated cyber-intimidation scheme. Perpetrators demanded a massive ransom from a Hetero Group employee. They threatened to share false information with the USFDA. This led to serious reputational and regulatory risks for the company. Police have arrested two individuals in connection with the racket.

items.title: State rules delay broadband, 5G expansion plans: Industry
items.summary: India's digital expansion faces hurdles due to differing state policies. These inconsistencies slow down fibre and small cell deployments, impacting broadband and 5G growth. Experts highlight varied Right of Way rules and approval processes as key challenges. This affects project timelines and investment. The central government's efforts to streamline rules are not fully adopted by all states, creating procedural bottlenecks.

items.title: DoT wants spectrum at 5% of AGR, rejects Digital Bharat Nidhi subsidy for satellite terminals
items.summary: The government has changed its plan for satellite communication firms. Instead of limiting customer numbers, companies like Starlink and Eutelsat OneWeb will face capacity-based restrictions. This means they can serve as many users as their approved capacity allows. Any increase in capacity will need new permissions. The government is also reviewing spectrum pricing for these providers.

items.title: Quality issues: Regulator looks to tighten marketing & sale of drugs
items.summary: India's drug regulator plans new rules for medicine marketers. Companies will need a license to sell and distribute drugs. This aims to improve drug quality and safety. The move will impact domestic and multinational firms. It is expected to help curb fake medicines. The regulator seeks to create a database of marketers for better oversight.

items.title: India may pip China in construction equipment sales by 2030: JCB India MD

items.title: Natural gas demand down 15% in October on high international prices
items.summary: Consumption in the April-October period is 8.1% lower year-on-year. A mild summer reduced demand from power generators, while tightening supplies of relatively cheaper domestically produced gas have also weighed on consumption. Domestic output fell 5.1% in October and 3.4% in April-October, driven by lower production from RIL-BP's KG basin fields.

These also cover social aspects, such as employee well-being, community engagement, human rights, and governance factors, including board diversity, ethics, anti-corruption measures, and risk management.

items.title: India imposes five-year anti-dumping duty on liquid epoxy resins imports from China and three other countries
items.summary: India has imposed a five-year anti-dumping duty on liquid epoxy resins. This measure targets imports from China, Saudi Arabia, Taiwan, and South Korea. The government aims to protect domestic producers from low-priced imports. This action follows an investigation into unfair pricing practices. The duty seeks to ensure fair competition and stable pricing for essential manufacturing inputs in the Indian market.

items.summary: The Sixteenth Finance Commission has presented its tax division recommendations to President Droupadi Murmu. The report outlines how the tax pool will be shared between the Centre and states for five years starting April 1, 2026. It also details the formula for distributing taxes among states. The commission visited all states and Union Territories.

items.title: Textile, apparel exports witness double-digit decline in October

Exporters are facing order cancellations, discounts, and reduced volumes due to the 50% tariff imposed by the US, which accounts for 28% of India's exports in this sector.

items.title: I-T return forms, rules under simplified Income Tax Act, 2025 to be released by January 2026
items.summary: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) will release simplified Income Tax return forms and rules for the new Income Tax Act, 2025, by January 2026. Chairman Ravi Agrawal assured that budgeted income tax collection targets will be met, attributing refund delays to system-flagged high-value transactions and ongoing analysis of claims.

items.title: Financial sector to aid next phase of transformation, says DEA secy Anuradha Thakur

She emphasized joint government-private action to strengthen the corporate bond market, expand investment trusts, and boost municipal bonds.  Thakur also noted significant structural shifts including the financialization of savings, a move away from bank-dominated credit, and increased equity market participation.

items.title: India-US trade pact: First stage 'nearing closure'
items.summary: India and the US are nearing closure on the first tranche of a bilateral trade agreement aimed at addressing significant tariffs on Indian goods. This package, focusing on reciprocal tariffs, is expected soon, while broader negotiations continue. India is also advancing free trade agreement talks with the EU, Peru, Chile, New Zealand, and ASEAN.

items.title: Goods exports down 11.8% in October, trade deficit widens on gold imports

Meanwhile, imports experienced a notable uptick of 16.6%, pushing them to $76.1 billion, primarily fueled by increased gold and silver transactions. This shift resulted in a trade deficit ballooning to $41.7 billion.

items.title: Unemployment rate steady at 5.2% in October
items.summary: As of October, India's unemployment rate remained stable at 5.2%, with significant shifts in the job market—rural unemployment declined, while urban joblessness increased. The labour force participation rate climbed to a robust 55.4%, thanks to heightened engagement from men across various regions. Additionally, a small reduction was noted in youth unemployment, hinting at potential improvements for the future workforce.

The panel recommends the share of net central taxes for states from April 1, 2026, to March 31, 2031. This crucial report will be presented in Parliament soon. The commission analyzed finances and consulted widely.
